Author: Imru al-Qais
Arabic_Text: قِفَا نَبْكِ مِنْ ذِكْرَى حَبِيبٍ وَمَنْزِلِ ‖ بِسِقْطِ اللِّوَى بَيْنَ الدَّخُولِ فَحَوْمَلِ
English_Translation: Let us stop and weep over the memory of a beloved and a dwelling ‖ At the edge of the sandy desert between Al-Dakhool and Hawmal

Author: Al-Mutanabbi
Arabic_Text: الخَيلُ وَاللَيلُ وَالبَيداءُ تَعرِفُني ‖ وَالسَيفُ وَالرُمحُ وَالقِرطاسُ وَالقَلَمُ
English_Translation: The horse the night and the desert know me ‖ As do the sword the spear the paper and the pen

Author: Abu al-Ala al-Ma'arri
Arabic_Text: أَرَانِي فِي الثَّلاثَةِ مِنْ سُجُونِي ‖ فَلا تَسْأَلْ عَن الخَبَرِ النَّبِيثِ
English_Translation: I find myself in three prisons ‖ So do not ask about the grim news

Author: Zuhair bin Abi Sulma
Arabic_Text: وَمَن لَم يُصانِع في أُمورٍ كَثيرَةٍ ‖ يُضَرَّس بِأَنيابٍ وَيوطَأ بِمَنسِمِ
English_Translation: And he who does not compromise in many matters ‖ Will be bitten by canines and trodden by hooves

Author: Al-Khansa
Arabic_Text: تَبكي خِناسٌ عَلَى صَخرٍ وَحَقَّ لَها ‖ إِذ رابَها الدَهرُ إِنَّ الدَهرَ ضَرّارُ
English_Translation: Khansa weeps for Sakhr and she has the right to ‖ When time has troubled her indeed time is harmful

Author: Quran
Arabic_Text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ ۝ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ۝ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ ۝ مَالِكِ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ
English_Translation: In the name of Allah the Most Gracious the Most Merciful ۝ All praise is due to Allah Lord of the worlds ۝ The Most Gracious the Most Merciful ۝ Master of the Day of Judgment

Author: Quran
Arabic_Text: قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ ۝ اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ ۝ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ ۝ وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
English_Translation: Say "He is Allah [who is] One ۝ Allah the Eternal Refuge ۝ He neither begets nor is born ۝ Nor is there to Him any equivalent"

Author: Quran
Arabic_Text: لَا يُكَلِّفُ اللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۚ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَعَلَيْهَا مَا اكْتَسَبَتْ
English_Translation: Allah does not burden a soul beyond that it can bear. It will have [the consequence of] what [good] it has gained and it will bear [the consequence of] what [evil] it has earned

Author: Quran
Arabic_Text: وَاعْتَصِمُوا بِحَبْلِ اللَّهِ جَمِيعًا وَلَا تَفَرَّقُوا ۚ وَاذْكُرُوا نِعْمَتَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ
English_Translation: And hold firmly to the rope of Allah all together and do not become divided. And remember the favor of Allah upon you

Author: Quran
Arabic_Text: وَقَضَى رَبُّكَ أَلَّا تَعْبُدُوا إِلَّا إِيَّاهُ وَبِالْوَالِدَيْنِ إِحْسَانًا
English_Translation: And your Lord has decreed that you not worship except Him and to parents good treatment

Author: Ibn al-Muqaffa
Arabic_Text: ليس العاقل من يعرف الخير من الشر، ولكن العاقل من يعرف خير الشرين
English_Translation: The wise person is not one who knows good from evil but one who recognizes the better of two evils

Author: Al-Jahiz
Arabic_Text: الكتاب وعاء ملىء علما، وظرف حشي ظرفا، وإناء شحن مزاحا وجدا
English_Translation: A book is a vessel filled with knowledge a container packed with wit and a receptacle loaded with both jest and seriousness

Author: Ibn Khaldun
Arabic_Text: إن الإنسان مدني بالطبع، أي لا بد له من الاجتماع الذي هو المدنية في اصطلاحهم
English_Translation: Man is civilized by nature meaning he must live in society which is what they term civilization

Author: Al-Hamadhani
Arabic_Text: وما أنا إلا رجل من العرب، آكل ما وجدت، وأمضي إذا لم أجد
English_Translation: I am but a man of the Arabs I eat what I find and I depart when I find nothing

Author: Ibn Tufail
Arabic_Text: فالحكمة هي السبيل إلى معرفة الله، ومعرفة الله هي السعادة العظمى
English_Translation: Wisdom is the path to knowing God and knowing God is the greatest happiness

Author: Ancient Arabic Proverb
Arabic_Text: الحاجة أم الاختراع
English_Translation: Necessity is the mother of invention

Author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
Arabic_Text: قيمة كل امرئ ما يحسنه
English_Translation: The worth of a man is in what he masters

Author: Ancient Arabic Proverb
Arabic_Text: إذا تم العقل نقص الكلام
English_Translation: When reason is complete speech becomes less

Author: Luqman
Arabic_Text: لسانك حصانك، إن صنته صانك، وإن هنته هانك
English_Translation: Your tongue is your steed; if you take care of it it takes care of you and if you humiliate it it humiliates you

Author: Ancient Arabic Proverb
Arabic_Text: عند الامتحان يكرم المرء أو يهان
English_Translation: At the time of testing a person is either honored or disgraced

Author: Treaty of Hudaybiyyah
Arabic_Text: بسمك اللهم، هذا ما صالح عليه محمد بن عبد الله سهيل بن عمرو
English_Translation: In Your name O Allah this is what Muhammad ibn Abdullah and Suhail ibn Amr have agreed upon

Author: Umar ibn al-Khattab
Arabic_Text: أما بعد، فإن القضاء فريضة محكمة، وسنة متبعة، فافهم إذا أدلي إليك
English_Translation: To proceed: Adjudication is a decisive obligation and a tradition to be followed so understand when cases are presented to you

Author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
Arabic_Text: وأشعر قلبك الرحمة للرعية، والمحبة لهم، واللطف بهم، ولا تكونن عليهم سبعاً ضارياً تغتنم أكلهم
English_Translation: Fill your heart with mercy love and kindness towards your subjects and do not act as a predatory beast that seeks to devour them

Author: Tariq ibn Ziyad
Arabic_Text: أيها الناس، أين المفر؟ البحر من ورائكم، والعدو أمامكم، وليس لكم والله إلا الصدق والصبر
English_Translation: O people where will you flee? The sea is behind you and the enemy is before you. By Allah you have only truthfulness and patience

Author: Pledge of Aqaba
Arabic_Text: بايعناك على السمع والطاعة في العسر واليسر، والمنشط والمكره
English_Translation: We pledge allegiance to you to listen and obey in ease and hardship in what we like and what we dislike

Author: Al-Kindi
Arabic_Text: الفلسفة هي معرفة الأشياء بحقائقها بقدر طاقة الإنسان
English_Translation: Philosophy is knowledge of the reality of things to the extent of human capacity

Author: Ibn Rushd
Arabic_Text: الحق لا يضاد الحق بل يوافقه ويشهد له
English_Translation: Truth does not contradict truth but rather agrees with it and bears witness to it

Author: Al-Farabi
Arabic_Text: العقل في الإنسان كالشمس في العالم
English_Translation: Intellect in man is like the sun in the world

Author: Ibn Sina
Arabic_Text: إن وجود النفس لا يحتاج إلى برهان، لأنها تدرك ذاتها من ذاتها
English_Translation: The existence of the soul needs no proof for it perceives itself by itself

Author: Al-Ghazali
Arabic_Text: العلم بلا عمل كالشجر بلا ثمر
English_Translation: Knowledge without action is like a tree without fruit

Author: Al-Hariri
Arabic_Text: وحدثنا عيسى بن هشام قال: دفعتني المقادير إلى صنعاء اليمن، ومعي بضاعة أرجو بها حسن الغبن
English_Translation: Isa ibn Hisham told us: Destiny drove me to Sanaa of Yemen and I had with me merchandise with which I hoped for a profitable transaction

Author: Arabian Nights
Arabic_Text: بلغني أيها الملك السعيد أنه كان في قديم الزمان وسالف العصر والأوان
English_Translation: It has reached me O fortunate King that in ancient times and bygone ages and periods

Author: Ibn Zaydun
Arabic_Text: أما بعد، فإني أكتب إليك من منزلة لو علمت بها الشمس لكسفت
English_Translation: To proceed: I write to you from a position that if the sun knew of it it would eclipse

Author: Kalila wa Dimna
Arabic_Text: إن الملك إذا كان شديد الغضب قليل الأناة محتاجًا إلى الغدر لم يثق به أحد
English_Translation: If a king is quick to anger lacks patience and resorts to treachery no one will trust him

Author: Al-Hamadhani
Arabic_Text: فلما انتصف الليل وهدأت العيون، سعى إلى الكيس سعي الأرقم، وأخذه أخذ الصقر
English_Translation: When midnight came and eyes were quieted he crept to the purse like a snake and seized it like a falcon
